question: My brother is in his 3rd year of chemo for Hep C.  He also suffers from schizophrenia, diabetes, and esophageal varices.  The outlook doesn't look good and his hepatologist has told me he is in end stage liver disease.My brother lives 1500 miles away with my 85 year old mother taking care of him...he does not want to move from the home he grew up in.  All of this is devastating to my mother. The plane trips, etc  to me for emergencies of my mother and brother are getting more frequent.What exactly is end stage liver disease?  Is it something you can live with for years?  I do not want to move my brother if he doesn't have that much longer to live...a year or so...but, I can't keep flying up and my mother can barely remember what day it is.  I will go and stay with them if his life expectancy is not long, but if it's more than about a year, I want to move them here.  His doctor has been vague in this area...end stage is all I get (and yes, she has written permission to discuss his health with me).Please help me with understanding what end stage liver entails.
title: End stage of liver disease
